address.docs:
**, int**: Manually specify the I²C address of the sensor. Default is `0x29`.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

auto_mode.docs:
**, boolean**: Automatic gain and integration time selection. Defaults to True.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

gain.docs:
**, string**: The gain the device will use. Higher values are better in low-light conditions. Valid values are `1X` *(default)*, `2X`, `4X`, `8X`, `48X`, `96X`.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

glass_attenuation_factor.docs:
**, float**: The attenuation factor of glass if it’s behind some glass or plastic facia.  Default is `1.0` means `100%` transmissivity. `2` means `50%` transmissivity etc.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

integration_time.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The amount of time sensors are exposed. Longer means more accurate values. Valid values are: `50ms` *(default)*, `100ms`, `150ms`, `200ms`, `250ms`, `300ms`, `350ms`, `400ms`.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

on_ps_high_threshold.docs:
Actions to perform when the proximity sensor is triggered on object getting closer.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

on_ps_low_threshold.docs:
Actions to perform when the proximity sensor is triggered on object getting further away.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

ps_cooldown.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The “cooldown” period after the proximity sensor is triggered. Helps to avoid multiple calls.  Defaults to `5s`.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

ps_gain.docs:
**, string**: The gain the device will use for proximity sensor. Higher values are better in low-light conditions. Valid values are `16X` *(default)*, `32X`, `64X`. Only for **LTR-659ALS**.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

ps_high_threshold.docs:
**, int**: The threshold for the proximity sensor to trigger on object getting closer. Defaults to `65535`, which implies it will never be triggered.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

ps_low_threshold.docs:
**, int**: The threshold for the proximity sensor to trigger on object getting further away. Defaults to `0`, which implies it will never be triggered.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

type.docs:
**, string**: The type of the sensor. Valid values are `ALS_PS` *(default)* for integrated sensors, `ALS` for ambient light only or `PS` for proximity only devices.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval for checking the sensors. Defaults to `60s`.

*See also: [Lite-On Ambient Light & Proximity Sensors](https://esphome.io/components/sensor/ltr_als_ps.html#configuration-variables)*
